intro: Alyxia halmaheirae, commonly known as the Halmaheira alyxia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the island of Madagascar and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has woody stems and opposite leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
